page.title: 06Saint John's Church
page.content: {Saint John's Church}is 805 years old. The original steeple fall through the ceiling and there was a temporary ceiling for two hundred years. There are{six bells}in the bell tower. This is a{Church of England church and it is built from{Chilmark stone, although some of it is{Tisbury stone. The ceiling is{oak}covered in {lead.}There is an old Chilmark stone altar but it is not used anymore. The church was{originally cross {shaped}but since the village has got bigger it had two side aisles added. The main memorials are the{Hyde {Brass}and the{Helmet of Lord Arundel. On record there have been thirty eight vicars. There are on average two marriages, eight funerals and ten christenings per month.
